intro: Thlaspi thessalonicum, commonly known as the Thessaly cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are edible and have a peppery taste similar to other members of the family. Thlaspi thessalonicum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in temperate climates.
